org.chronos.chronodb.internal.util

Class ThreadBound<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chronos.chronodb.internal.util.ThreadBound<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of element contained in this object.

    public class ThreadBound<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A ThreadBound object is similar to a ThreadLocal, except that the memory management is different.

    In a regular ThreadLocal, the value is stored in the thread until the thread dies. This is true even if there is no way to access this value in regular Java code anymore. In a ThreadBound object, the value is cleared if:

    • The thread dies and is GC'ed OR
    • the object owning the ThreadBound is no longer reachable and GC'ed.
    In contrast to ThreadLocal, this class also allows to clear the contained value for all threads via clearValueForAllThreads().

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <T> ThreadBound<T> create()
        Creates a new ThreadBound instance.
        Returns:
        The newly created instance. Never null.

      • createWeakReference

        public static <T> ThreadBound<T> createWeakReference()
        Creates a new ThreadBound instance with weakly referenced values.
        Returns:
        The newly created instance. Never null.

      • get

        public T get()
        Returns the value associated with the current thread.
        Returns:
        The value. May be null if the thread does not have a value yet (or was explicitly assigned a null value).

      • set

        public T set(T value)
        Associates the given value with the current thread.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to store. May be null.
        Returns:
        The previous value. May be null. If no previous value existed for the given thread, null will be returned.

      • unset

        public T unset()
        Removes the value associated with the current thread.

        After invoking this method, calls to get() will always return null until a new, non-null value is assigned via set(Object).

        Returns:
        The previously assigned value. May be null. If no previous value existed for the given thread, null will be returned.

      • clearValueForAllThreads

        public void clearValueForAllThreads()
        Clears the stored value for all threads.

        After invoking this method, calls to get() will always return null for all threads until a new, non-null value is assigned via set(Object).
